title: Refers to data
description: Data type, changes in data, refer to the data directly
ExampleTxt: Example：Daily Covid cases surge 60% in a week to 61,900 in biggest rise since Freedom Day as admissions climb by a quarter and deaths creep up 9%

title: States an issue
description: States an issue (fact or study) but not the data directly
ExampleTxt: Example: Elections 2022: live council results for England, Scotland and Wales

title: Makes a judgment
description: Makes a judgment on the data or the issue at hand
ExampleTxt: Example：Digital banks beat the high street on customer service

title: Ask a question
description: Use the question as the title directly
ExampleTxt: Example：Does Gen Z spend too much time on social media?

title: Include emotional appeal
description: Use emotional adjectives(on the data or the fact) to arouse users' feelings
ExampleTxt: Example：Boris Johnson’s tumultuous three years as prime minister – in charts

title: give the link
description: Give the relevant database link directly then people can click to enter
ExampleTxt: Example: Data from ___Effis___ shows that as of 23 July
ExampleImag: 000 hectares (1.27m acres) of land had been burned across EU countries. This is four times the average recorded since 2006
column8: and is nearly twice the previous record seen across this time.

title: Mention the data source name only
description: Cite the name of the institute/data report/website without giving a link
ExampleTxt: Example: The NHS has succeeded in eliminating two-year waits, but in future the length of delays in treatment looks set to creep up again.
